articles.title: Angry right-wing protesters confront TX Republican Rep. Dan Crenshaw - CNN Video
articles.description: Republican Dan Crenshaw responds to an angry right-wing protester after they confronted him and his staff at the Republican Party of Texas Convention.

articles.title: What to watch for in January 6 hearing focused on pressure campaign in the states

articles.title: Live updates: Russia's war in Ukraine
articles.description: Russian forces attacking the key eastern city of Severodonetsk have enough firepower to launch a large-scale offensive, the Luhansk regional military chief said. Follow live updates here.

articles.author: Opinion by Franchetta Groves
articles.title: Opinion: A lot of young women worry about the end of Roe. I would celebrate it
articles.description: College student Franchetta Groves doesn't see the imminent move by the Supreme Court to strike down Roe v. Wade as a setback but rather as a triumph for those such as herself who support anti-abortion positions.
articles.content: Franchetta Groves is a senior at the Catholic University of America in Washington, D.C. She is the campus marketing chair of the Network of Enlightened Women, a national organization of conservative … [+7284 chars]

articles.author: Opinion by Laurence H. Tribe and Dennis Aftergut
articles.title: Opinion: Republican election sabotage has already started. New Mexico is proof of that
articles.description: Republican election sabotage, in which GOP officials refuse to certify the winners, has started. It will be up to citizens to block it. We can do that at the ballot box and in other ways, write legal scholars Laurence H. Tribe and Dennis Aftergut.
articles.content: Laurence H. Tribe is the Carl M. Loeb University professor emeritus and a professor of constitutional law emeritus at Harvard Law School. Dennis Aftergut, a former federal prosecutor, is currently of… [+7405 chars]

articles.title: Supreme Court rushes to end a term like no other

articles.author: Opinion by Dean Obeidallah
articles.title: Opinion: Republicans in Texas just voted to reject democracy
articles.description: The Texas Republican Convention rejected the outcome of a democratic election, supported bigotry toward the LGBTQ community and imposed far-right beliefs on others by seeking to have them enshrined into law, writes Dean Obeidallah.
